docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order (ASC/DESC). Defaults to ASC

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: fields
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Can not be used together with 'cursorPaging'

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Can't be used together with 'paging'. 'cursorPaging.cursor' can not be used together with 'filter' or 'sort'

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: previousEntityAsJson
members.doc:
This field is currently part of the of the EntityUpdatedEvent msg, but scala/node libraries which implements the domain events standard
 wont populate it / have any reference to it in the API.
 The main reason for it is that fetching the old entity from the DB will have a performance hit on an update operation so unless truly needed,
 the developer should send only the new (current) entity.
 An additional reason is not wanting to send this additional entity over the wire (kafka) since in some cases it can be really big
Developers that must reflect the old entity will have to implement their own domain event sender mechanism which will follow the DomainEvent proto message.

members.name: id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dipatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
 Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dipatching

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
 For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.

members.name: phone
members.doc: the blocked phone number

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: the timestamp of when the number was blocked

members.name: userId
members.doc: the user id of the user who blocked

members.name: userName
members.doc: the name of the user who blocked the number

members.name: virtualNumberAccountId
members.doc: Virtual number account ID

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting details

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.
